alert.note: Alert for Chester; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 7:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING AND TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG...NORTHWESTERN CHESTER AND CENTRAL YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 800 PM EDT... At 721 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 4 miles north of Chester, or near Lowrys, moving north at 25 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Rock Hill, York, Chester, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Mcconnells, Lowrys and Steele Creek. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions will cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
